meanings.definition: The position or attitude of the body or a person's limbs.
meanings.sent1: Her ballet teacher corrected her postures during the class.
meanings.sent2: Good postures can help prevent back pain.
meanings.sent3: The robot's postures were so stiff, it looked like it needed oiling.
meanings.sent4: The postures of the trees in the wind resembled a graceful dance.
meanings.sent5: Grandma always reminded us to have proper postures at the dinner table.

meanings.definition: A particular way of standing or sitting.
meanings.sent1: His slouching postures made him appear lazy.
meanings.sent2: The yoga instructor demonstrated different postures to the class.
meanings.sent3: The cat's postures while grooming itself were quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The postures of the statues in the museum conveyed a sense of power.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's postures were rigid and disciplined during the ceremony.

meanings.definition: To assume a particular attitude or position.
meanings.sent1: She postures confidently during her presentation.
meanings.sent2: The politician postures to appear more relatable to the voters.
meanings.sent3: The toddler postures as if they are the king of the playground.
meanings.sent4: The cat postures itself to look bigger when faced with a threat.
meanings.sent5: The actor postures dramatically on stage to captivate the audience.
